Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of two feet, to left; below, part of one narrow brown band; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The shape is in part determined by the possibility of inscribing on the inside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0238) (Phase 1)
